Dear Ms. Taylor:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff slammed youth into a wooden wall then on the ground
several times. Youth had a busted lip that was bleeding and
scraped knee and elbow. Youth did not see a nurse for his
injuries.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on 11/7/2024.
Complainant was informed of the allegations from Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A
reported Staff 1 slammed him into the wall in the entry way near the
cafeteria resulting in both of his knees and right elbow being
2

scrapped up and his lip bleeding. Youth A reported no other staff or
youth witnessed the incident. Youth A reported he was in the
hallway around shift change (2-2:30pm) attempting to leave the
building. Staff 1 had been Youth A’s one on one staff for the
morning shift and was leaving for the day. Youth A reported he was
attempting to run out the door when Staff 1 grabbed his arms and
torso with both hands and slammed Youth A into the wall. Youth A
reported Staff 1 slammed him into the wall one time and it happened
quick. Youth A reported Staff 1 said “stop playing with me Nigger”
when he slammed Youth A into the wall. Youth A reported
Supervisor came over to the doorway after Staff 1 slammed him
into the wall however did not see Staff 1 slam him or Youth A
bleeding. Youth A reported Staff 2 was his second shift one on one
staff on that day. Youth A did not recall the date of the incident
however reported it was before Halloween and was after he climbed
the antenna (This is being investigated under Special Investigation
2025SIC000008). Youth A reported he did not see medical for his
injuries. Youth A reported he saw Nurse after the incident and told
Nurse he needed to see her due to Staff 1 slamming him into the
wall. Youth A reported Nurse told him to fill out a medical slip.
Youth A did not fill out a medical slip.
Youth A reported earlier the same morning Staff 1 grabbed him and
slammed him to the ground several times in the grass when he was
outside trying to climb onto the roof. Youth A reported his whole
body was sore from being slammed to the ground. Youth A
reported Administrative Assistant witnessed Staff 1 slam him to the
ground.
Additionally, Youth A reported Staff 1 slammed Youth B on the
ground while off site on Enterprise Drive. Youth A reported he did
not see this occur however Staff 1 said “I did Dada so bold” meaning
Staff 1 slammed Youth B to the ground. Youth A reported Youth B
never said anything to him about Staff 1 slamming him to the
ground.
Youth B was interview via teams on 12/5/2024 in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker. Youth B reported he was previously placed
at Clarence Fischer Center. Youth B reported Staff 1 was a staff at
the facility. Youth B reported no concerns with Staff 1 and Staff 1
treated him and the other youth good. Youth B reported Staff 1
never slammed him to the ground or any other youth that he was
aware of.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at McDonalds on
11/19/2024 and via telephone on 12/5/2024 in collaboration with
3

MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported Youth A was upset in the
cafeteria area and making statements about how no one cares
about him except when he is climbing the antenna as he had done
the day before, so he was going to climb the antenna again. Staff
1 reported Youth A began walking to the door and he went on the
side of Youth A and “put him on the wall”. Staff 1 demonstrated what
he meant by “put him on the wall” as standing next to Youth A and
using his upper body to shoulder Youth A into the wall. Staff 1
demonstrated the shoulder-to-shoulder push into the wall and
reported he used a little force to push Youth A against the wall. Staff
1 reported he was informed by law enforcement that Youth A was
alleging Staff 1 hurt his should, knee, and busted his lip which Staff
1 reported never happened nor could it due to there being no way
all those places on Youth A’s body could have been injured from
him using his shoulder to place Youth A on the wall. Staff 1 reported
Youth A was on the wall for a second. Staff 1 reported Youth A said,
“this is bullshit” and went back to the unit and the incident was over.
Staff 1 denied ever calling Youth A the “N” word or slamming Youth
A to the ground or on to the wall. Staff 1 denied Youth A bleeding
from anywhere on his body after he went shoulder-to-shoulder with
him against the wall. Staff 1 reported Youth A was facing the door
to go outside, and he was facing the opposite way when he went
shoulder-to-shoulder with him.
Staff 1 denied ever slamming Youth A to the ground outside on the
grass when Youth A was attempting to climb the antenna. Staff 1
denied there ever being a time when he and Youth A fell to the
ground outside when he was attempting to get Youth A down from
climbing the antenna.
Staff 1 denied ever slamming Youth B to the ground or telling
anyone he did and/or insinuating he did.
A follow up interview was held with Staff 1 via telephone on
12/5/2024 after the video footage was able to be reviewed. Staff 1
reported he did not recall exactly what happened that day. Staff 1
reported the facility policy and procedure is to block youth or stop
youth from going outside. Staff 1 reported if a youth gets violent
while trying to stop them from going outside then staff are to let the
youth go and follow the youth. Staff 1 reported he did not place
Youth A in a restraint that day. Staff 1 reported he pushed Youth A
into the wall and stopped him from going outside with his arm. Staff
1 reported it is not a trained technique at the facility. Staff 1 reported
he lost his cool that day.
4

Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 12/5/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported Staff 1
worked first shift and she worked second shift. Staff 2 reported one
day in October she came into work and Staff 1 left his shift without
debriefing before she took over working with Youth A. Staff 2
reported when she arrived at work Youth A told her Staff 1 placed
him in a restraint and “grabbed him wrong”. Staff 2 reported Youth
A was “in a mood” and did not elaborate any further on what he
meant when he said “grabbed him wrong”. Staff 2 reported she took
Youth A outside for a walk and Youth A saw Nurse drive by and
flagged her down. Youth A told Nurse something along the lines of
Staff 1 does not know how to do his job and “grabbed him wrong”
however did not elaborate on what that meant. Nurse asked Youth
A if he would like to report the incident and Youth A said no. Youth
A never asked Nurse to see him. Nurse asked Youth A if he needed
any medical attention and Youth A said no. Staff 2 reported she did
not see any injuries or blood on Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A
did not report any injuries to her. Staff 2 did not recall Youth A telling
her anything about Staff 1 slamming him into a wall.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
11/19/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor
reported she saw Youth A and Staff 1 in the hallway leading outside
on one occasion however did not recall the date. Supervisor
reported there were multiple other youth also in the hallway and
Staff 1 was standing by the training room door and Youth A was
standing in the hall. Supervisor reported she did not see any blood
on Youth A’s face or Youth A bleeding from anywhere on his body.
Supervisor reported Youth A was saying Staff 1 was “pissing him
off” as Staff 1 was following Youth A and Youth A did not want him
as his staff. Supervisor did not see Staff 1 slam Youth A against the
wall at any time. Supervisor reported she never heard anything
about Staff 1 slamming Youth B on the ground.
Nurse was interviewed via telephone on 11/21/2024 in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Nurse reported she did not
recall Youth A asking to see her nor was she aware of Youth A
having a bloody lip. Nurse reported she has examined Youth A for
scraped elbows and knees however did not recall the date, nor did
Youth A tell her what the scrapes were from. Nurse reported Youth
A never approached her and stated he needed to see her due to
Staff 1 slamming him and that he would need to fill out a medical
slip. Nurse reported she is housed in another building at the facility
and Youth A would not have access to approach her unless she
had been on the unit for something. Medical slips are to be filled
5

out when a youth has a headache or stomachache, never for when
a youth is in immediate pain or has an injury.
Administrative Assistant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 11/19/2024 in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Administrative Assistant reported she has witnessed Youth A
attempting to get onto the roof of the building a few times. One time
Youth A was attempting to climb up the antenna and was
approximately one to two steps up when Staff 1 placed his hands
on Youth A’s sides and Youth A pushed off the steps with both feet
resulting in Youth A and Staff 1 both falling to the ground.
Administrative Assistant reported she never saw Staff 1 slam Youth
A to the ground. Administrative Assistant reported after Youth A and
Staff 1 fell to the ground, Youth A got up and ran and Staff 1
followed Youth A. Administrative Assistant did not see what
happened after that as she went inside the building.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 10/22/2024 in the hallway leading outside near the
training room door was reviewed on 11/21/2024. Youth A walked
down the hall toward the door and Staff 1 came running behind
Youth A. Youth A began to run and Staff 1 placed his left arm on
Youth A (unable to see where from the video footage) and his right
arm around Youth A’s back and moved Youth A into the wall. Youth
A arms are bent with his forearms on the wall as Youth A held his
head back from hitting the wall. Youth A’s body bounced off the wall
and Staff 1 stepped to the side with his hand near the underneath
of Youth A’s chin as Youth A fell to the ground onto his knees and
back onto his buttock. Youth A’s left knee appeared to hit the
wooden wall as he was falling back onto his buttocks. Youth A got
up and attempted to hit Staff 1 with an open hand. Staff 1 placed
his arms on Youth A’s upper arms as Youth A was standing
sideways toward him. Staff 1 turned Youth A to face forward with
Staff 1 standing behind him and had his left arm over Youth A’s
shoulder with his right arm around Youth A’s upper forearm
securing Youth A’s arms. Youth A appeared to be moving to get
out of the hold. Staff 1’s left arm moved up off Youth A’s upper bicep
area toward Youth A’s neck as Youth A was moving to get out of
the hold. Staff 1 dropped his left arm and Youth A moved his head
out of Staff 1’s arm. Youth A stood facing Staff 1. It is unknown
what is said as there is no audio on the video. Staff 1 took a few
steps back from Youth A and Youth A stepped toward Staff 1. Staff
1 pushed Youth A back. Youth A walked over to the training room
door. It is unclear if Youth A has any blood on his lip or his knees
as it is difficult to see in the video.
6

Documents Reviewed:
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Support and
Management Policy: Non-violent – Restrictive intervention is
defined a as staff member’s use of physical control to contain
a client’s acute physical behavior. a physical hold to
maximize safety and minimize harm, i.e. any behavior that
is likely to result in physical injury or imminent risk of physical
harm of the client, other clients, staff members, or others.
These interventions are non-violent and are to be used in
such a manner as to not be hostile or injurious. All non-
violent physical interventions at Wolverine Human Services
will follow the principles established by the CPI curriculum.
• Wolverine Human Services Behavior Notification dated
10/22/2024 for Youth A at 2:25PM: Youth A began acting out
in the cafeteria (cussing, punching the trash cans over, and
spilling trash over the floor, throwing chairs against the wall).
Staff 1 managed the environment and used directive
statements until Youth A stopped and was taken outside to
calm down.
• Vassar Police Department Incident Number 24-3517 dated
11/7/2024 was consistent with Youth A’ and Staff 1’s
interviews.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had one discipline dated
10/22/2024 for leaving shift without completing the required
paperwork. Staff 1 completed CPI training on 7/15/2024.
Staff 1 signed acknowledgement of the facilities Behavior
Management policy on 7/23/2024. Staff 1 was terminated
from the facility on 11/2/2024 due to line of sight and failure
to intervene.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 slammed Youth A
into the wall per Youth A’s interview and video footage. Staff 1
also pushed Youth A per video footage. Staff 1 originally reported
he used his shoulder to guide Youth A into the wall however in
later interview Staff 1 admitted to pushing Youth A into the wall to
prevent Youth A from going outside.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
